img.title: These rocks are from a time before eyes, brains, and bones, pieces of a land warmed by an unseen sun.
img.alt: These rocks are from a time before eyes, brains, and bones, pieces of a land warmed by an unseen sun.

img.title: "One popular strategy is to enter an emotional spiral. Could that be the right approach? We contacted several researchers who are experts in emotional spirals to ask them, but none of them were in a state to speak with us."
img.alt: "One popular strategy is to enter an emotional spiral. Could that be the right approach? We contacted several researchers who are experts in emotional spirals to ask them, but none of them were in a state to speak with us."

item.title: LovingReaper: Heaven (2)
item.description: Part two: alternative subtitle: how to try in vain to cram far too many ideas into a short story. Oh well, I tried.

img.title: Though they do appreciate how much he improved the heating system for the flame pit.
img.alt: Though they do appreciate how much he improved the heating system for the flame pit.

img.title: We were disappointed that the rocket didn't make a THOOOONK noise when it went into the tube, but we're setting up big loudspeakers for future launches to add the sound effect.
img.alt: We were disappointed that the rocket didn't make a THOOOONK noise when it went into the tube, but we're setting up big loudspeakers for future launches to add the sound effect.

item.title: LovingReaper: Stuck
item.description: I'm just saying there are better alternatives... I'm sure you'll recognize some elements here (especially the floating WHOA souls) that's because this is a very old comic I created years ago and wanted to finally finish it. It's... okay. Anyway, I can work more effectively in the near future and upload more comics. Thanks for your patience :)

item.title: AwkwardYeti: Webcomicon 2024
item.description: I’m hosting the most epic gathering of online cartoonists this August in Ferndale, Michigan! For more information and tickets, go to Webcomicon.net Tickets are limited! Order ahead online to guarantee entry.

item.title: LovingReaper: HI! I'M CHARLIE!
item.description: Senior pets have a hard time getting adopted. The likelihood of adoption is only 25% compared to 60% for a younger dog. Unfortunately, this is often due to prejudice. I want to raise awareness with this comic (and also get back to my roots, which I haven't really managed to do yet). But I want to start uploading more regularly again. Thank you for your patience so far.

item.title: LovingReaper: Did you hear that?
item.description:
Link for pre-order: linktr.ee/JennyJinya
Thank you so much and especially thank you for your patience :')

item.description: Practice makes perfect.

item.title: LovingReaper: Funeral
item.description:
Did you know that crows hold "funerals" for their dead?
By the way: Boris is real and lives with John in the Netherlands. John found him badly injured and unable to fly, he would be lost in the wild. John has been looking after Boris for years and lets him out into the wild (under guard) as often as possible. John also works with Boris to educate people about crows and wildlife. Amazing Team!

item.title: PixieAndBrutus: Memory
item.description: Minnesota is known as "The Land of Ten Thousand Lakes" but actually we have closer to fourteen thousand that are 10 acres or larger.

item.title: LovingReaper: Among the Stars
item.description: My last comic for this year, in collaboration with @rwritextinction and Barba.no, a Norwegian Arctic exploration and education organisation. But for now, whatever you celebrate (or not) I hope you'll have relaxing holidays) ❤

item.title: LovingReaper: Flowers
item.description: And that's why we give them flowers 🌸🌻🌹 Have a nice and colorful Easter 😊 (But please don't gift any live animals, thank you)

item.title: LovingReaper: Sit with us?
item.description: Would you have him deliver a message? Would you trust him with that?

item.title: LovingReaper: Dear Trixi
item.description: My best friend died. As you may have noticed, my dog lost her battle against her tumor last month. The dog that inspired so many of my comics and was always by my side. This is the most painful piece, but it was therapeutic in a way to say goodbye to Trixi in this way. Goodbye my "curly banana", you were loved so so much...

item.title: LovingReaper: Follow me
item.description: I have not only a little Christmas story for you, but also a continuation of "Black Cats". Because I don't want to leave you sad for the holidays, you'll get to know Reaper's secret little helper. Even the cold can harbor so much goodness. Wish you a wonderful time :)

item.title: LovingReaper: Pumkin time
item.description: I had a quick idea for a bittersweet Halloween comic. Please pay close attention to where your cats hide outside when it is cold ❤ Happy Halloween! ��

item.title: LovingReaper: A seed of compassion
item.description: For grandma, who loved pigeons, and for grandpa, who did not but wanted her to be happy. Please hear me out <3
